name: gc_ode_colon_glands
title: AutoPET challenge winner: False Positive Reduction Network

summary.description: Ordinary Differential Equations algorithm for segmentation of individual colon glands

inputs.label: Colon histology image
inputs.description: Hematoxylin and Eosin (H&E) stained colon histology image

outputs.description: Colon glands segmentation for the input histology image. Each individual segmented colon gland is assigned a different label.

model.architecture: U-Node network based on a combination of Neural Ordinary Differential Equations (NODE) and a U-Net

details.name: U-Node architecture
details.cite: H. Pinckaers and G. Litjens, 'Neural Ordinary Differential Equations for Semantic Segmentation of Individual Colon Glands', In arXiv:1910.10470, doi: 10.48550/arXiv:1910.10470.

publications.title: Neural Ordinary Differential Equations for Semantic Segmentation of Individual Colon Glands

use.title: Intended use
use.text: Segmentation of the colon glands in H&E stained colon histology slides. Only intended for data similar to the data found in the colon gland segmentation dataset for the GlaS challenge.

references.label: Gland segmentation in colon histology images: The glas challenge contest

analyses.title: Evaluation
analyses.text: The model was evaluated using the GlaS challenge metrics against the test dataset. A weighted Dice coefficient per gland (object Dice), a gland detection F1 score, and a weighted shape similarity metric based on the Hausdorff distance (where lower is better). Results can be found in [1].

references.label: Neural Ordinary Differential Equations for Semantic Segmentation of Individual Colon Glands

evaluation.title: Evaluation data
evaluation.text: The GlaS dataset has a test set with 80 images. The majority are 775x522 pixel patches from scanned whole-slide histology images of the colon, where epithelial glands have ben annotated. The test dataset is divided into two subsets: subset A (60 images) and subset B (20 images).

training.title: Training data
training.text: The GlaS dataset has a training set with 85 images. The majority are 775x522 pixel patches from scanned whole-slide histology images of the colon, where epithelial glands have ben annotated.

limitations.title: Limitations
limitations.text: This algorithm was developed for research purposes only.
